items.title: How TypeScript 4.9 satisfies
items.content:
#â€‹608 â€” September 30, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Web Almanac 2022's Take on the State of JavaScript (As It IsÂ Used) â€” Whatâ€™s better: a survey, or real world usage data from 8 million Web sites? If you prefer the latter, this is for you. The Web Almanac is an annual â€˜state of the webâ€™ report into what technologies are being used online and amongst the over 20 chapters of insights is a JavaScript-specific chapter. SomeÂ highlights:

  • More JavaScript is going over the wire than ever before. 1.3MB for a page only puts you at the 90th percentile(!) About half of it goes unused too..
  • 77% of mobile pages have render-blocking scripts in <head>
  • Dynamic import is barely used â€“ about 0.3-0.4% of pages.
  • Web workers are used on 12% of pages.
  • Of the 1,000 most popular sites, 17% use webpack, about 1.5% for Parcel.
  • Psst.. jQuery is still used all over the place..

Jeremy Wagner and the HTTP Archive

Build a Slack Integration in a Few Lines ofÂ JavaScript â€” Donâ€™t sweat notifications on any channel. Slack? Push? SMS? Email? Do it all with consistent formatting and logs that anyone can read that are easyÂ toÂ audit.

Courier sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 4.9 Beta â€” This is a very satisfying update that introduces the satisfies operator for when you want to validate a type of an expression matches some type but without changing the actual resulting type. The in operator also becomes more powerful when narrowing types with unlistedÂ properties.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

The 'New Wave' of JavaScript Web Frameworks â€” A few months ago he covered the new wave of React state management and now Rem is back trying to â€œmake sense of the proliferation of new Javascript web frameworks.â€ As are we all. Vue, Svelte, Solid, Remix, Astro and Qwik all make an appearanceÂ here.

Rem

IN BRIEF:

  • Did you know VS Code has a 'timeline' view that lets you go back and forth through states of your files?

  • Cloudflare has unveiled Turnstile, its take on an invisible CAPTCHA-like service for protecting webapps. How does it work? JavaScript-based challenges, explains The Register.

  • On the topic of Cloudflare, it has released workerd, an open source version of its JavaScript-oriented FaaS Workers platform.

  • Node.js has had a swathe of security releases.

  • AWS App Runner, AWS's 'throw an app at us and we'll run it' service, now supports Node.js 16.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js 18.10.0 (Current)

  • Neutralino.js 4.8
    â†³ Lightweight cross-platform desktop app framework.

  • Boa 0.16
    â†³ JS lexer, parser and compiler written in Rust.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Use .NET From Any JavaScript App in .NET 7 â€” A showcase of the JavaScript to .NET interop by way of a port of the famous TodoMVC to .NET running via WebAssembly. Blazor is the most commonly associated framework with .NET and C# in the browser, but the support works independently of BlazorÂ too.

Pavel Å avara (Microsoft)

Writing Composable SQL using JavaScript â€” There are many approaches to working with SQL databases and the author prefers plain SQL and Slonik. If you prefer something more abstract, of course, Knex.js is still anÂ option.

Gajus Kuizinas

How to Monitor a Next.js Application â€” Learn how to monitor both the server side and client slide of a Next.js application, including adding logs inÂ context.

New Relic sponsor

Building an Accessible Select Component in React â€” A step-by-step (or should we say brick-by-brick?) tutorial on how to build a select component specifically with accessibility in mind, a topic an international business like LEGO has at itsÂ heart.

Kacper Kula (Lego)

A Quick Guide to Phone Vibration with JavaScript â€” Learn how to do this, then donâ€™t do it unless you really, really, really have to.. please? ğŸ˜

Pete Fowler

Testing React Apps with Cypress: An In-Depth Guide forÂ Beginners
Johannes Kettmann

â–¶Â Â An Introduction to Pinia, Vue's Recommended Store Library
John Komarnicki

Watch Out What You Expose with Angular Interceptors
Tim Deschryver

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Billboard.js 3.6: D3.js-Based JavaScript Chart Library â€” The hugely powerful and popular chat library now has an official React wrapper, a new â€˜linear gradientâ€™ bar chart option, and . Demos and GitHubÂ repo.

Jae Sung Park

Liqe: Lightweight Lucene-like Parser and Search Engine â€” Lets you use Lucene-style search query syntax to query or test things you already have in JavaScript objects, e.g. filter(parse('height:>170'), people);

Gajus Kuizinas

Wallaby.js: 15x Faster JavaScript Testing, Now with Support for Vitest â€” Wallaby runs tests as you type, with real-time runtime values, errors and coverage displayed next to yourÂ code.

Wallaby.js sponsor

create-t3-app: Interactive CLI to Quickly Set Up an Opinionated, Full-Stack, Type-Safe Next.js Project â€” Thereâ€™s even a 10-minute screencast from Theo - pingâ€¤gg showing off how to useÂ it.

T3 Open Source

Glide.js 3.6: A Dependency-Free Slider and Carousel Control â€” â€œDesigned to slide. No less, no moreâ€ says the creator. MIT licensed andÂ mature.

JÄ™drzej ChaÅ‚ubek

Preview.js: Fast Component Previews in Your IDE â€” This extension will automatically generate valid props in your components in the preview, has support for CSS-in-JS, and works offline. Available for VS Code and IntelliJ/WebStorm, and supports Solid and Vue componentsÂ too.

Zenc Labs

ğŸ…°ï¸ Â 'Photoshop Export Layers to Files Fast' â€” Did you know you can script Adobe Photoshop using JavaScript? Itâ€™s quite powerful, but I found it hard to find good examples to learn from when I played with it â€“ so this project is veryÂ welcome.

Hanna W

Ezno: An Experimental JavaScript Compiler â€” The latest in a long line of JavaScript compilation experiments â€“ and weâ€™re all here for it. This post explains the philosophy and reasoning and why type checking is at the heart of it: â€œYou can think of it as an extension to TSC, similar ideas but takenÂ further.â€

Ben X

Code Capsules: The Simplest Way to Deploy Your Code

Code Capsules sponsor

textlint: A Pluggable Linting Tool for Text and Markdown â€” Imagine ESLint but for natural language and punctuation. Markdown and text are supported out of the box, but other formats can be added (e.g. HTML). Thereâ€™s an online playground if you want to try itÂ out.

Textlint Team

âš¡ï¸ OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

  • react-number-format 5.0
    â†³ Component to format numbers in an input or as text.

  • jest-native 5.0
    â†³ Jest matchers to test the state of React Native apps.

  • Pogo 0.6
    â†³ Server framework for Deno.

  • Eruption
    â†³ â€˜Next generationâ€™ boilerplate for React/TypeScript, built on top of Vite.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” Join the CKEditor team to develop an Open Source project used by millions of users around the world ğŸš€and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ‘€Â Â Well, okay..

You've got some semi-structured data written in Markdown and want to convert it to JSON. What do you do? â–¶ï¸ Get OpenAI's GPT-3 machine learning model to do it of course..(!)

items.title: Extractors for ECMAScript
items.content:
#â€‹607 â€” September 23, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Tesseract.js 3.0: Pure JS OCR for Over 100 Languages â€” A port of the C++-based Tesseract library commonly used for visual text recognition. It can even work upon videos in real time. v3 boasts a big performance boost with 84% lower running time and now uses SIMD where supported. GitHubÂ repo.

Tesseract Team

A Proposed JS Feature: Extractor Objects â€” Entering stage one at the latest TC39 meeting is a proposal for being able to define your own logic (such as data validation or transformation) to run as part of the object destructuring process. A proposal worthÂ reviewing.

Ecma TC39 / Ron Buckton

Hello World. Caching. Globally. Simplified. â€” PolyScale connects to your current database and executes your queries at the edge, for low global latency. Plug-and-play with Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, MS SQL. PS: we also invalidate automaticallyÂ ğŸ˜‰

PolyScale.ai sponsor

'React I Love You, but Youâ€™re Bringing Me Down' â€” An opinionated React thought piece â€“ hurrah ğŸ˜† The author gets creative by looking at React's progress in a â€˜mix tapeâ€™ style with code and memes sprinkled in for goodÂ measure. (Hacker News went deep on this item and spawned some interesting sub-threads.)

FranÃ§ois Zaninotto opinion

IN BRIEF:

  • A minor TC39 update from their 92nd meeting. The main news is Array.fromAsync moves to stage three.

  • There are likely to be new versions of Node 14.x, 16.x, and 18.x later today to fix a few security issues.

  • GitHub has announced Web based auth now works for all npm commands.

  • The Ember.js framework team has unveiled a preview of official support forÂ TypeScript.

RELEASES:

Glide 3.6 â€“ Dependency-free slider and carousel control.
React Calendar 3.9 â€“ Powerful calendar component.
Qwik 0.9 â€“ The low-JS HTML-first framework.
Electron 20.2

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Type-Level TypeScript: The Basics â€” A beautifully presented guide to types, complete with challenges to solve. While 11 'chapters' are promised to take you â€˜from intermediate to advancedâ€™, only the first two are currently available. They cover the fundamentals of what types of types TypeScript makes available toÂ us.

Gabriel Vergnaud

ğŸ“— Â Shell Scripting with Node.js â€” Axel has spent months digging into the realities of using Node as a scripting language â€“ here's the end result. You can support him by buying it and/or read the whole book online.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Send Email, Push and SMS with Smart Routing, with Just 8 Lines ofÂ Code â€” Are you stuck using marketing tools like salesforce to contact your users? Send notifications from right within your application using the CourierÂ API.

Courier sponsor

â–¶Â Â How to Build a Scrollable Text Gallery in Three.js â€” An attempt at reproducing the striking scrolling text effect on display at Design Embraced. This is typography and â€˜web designâ€™ turned up toÂ 11..

Yuri Artiukh

Rest vs Spread Syntax: ... vs ... â€” Quick: whatâ€™s the difference between ... and ...? Trick question. While they look the same, two different things can be represented by them.

Amit Merchant

Whatâ€™s New in Gatsby in 2022? â€” What Gatsby â€“ the React-based 'reactive site generator' â€“ can do today, along with how to use some of the new features to ease the upgrade from v2 toÂ v4.

Paul Scanlon

Real World Node.js Native Binary Compilation with pkg
Daniel Bradley

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Linkify 4.0: Link Up URLs, Email Addresses, and More in Plain Text â€” Given some plain text containing things like links and emails, Linkify will generate the correct code to display it on the Web. Not just URLs or emails, but hashtags, @mentions, IP addresses, and more. GitHubÂ repo.

Hypercontext

TinyBase 2.0: A Library for Structuring App State â€” For when you want a bit more database-esque structure around the management of state in your apps. The demos are well explained so check those out. GitHubÂ repo.

James Pearce

Integrate eSignatures in Your App in Less Than a Week â€” Enable document signing from anywhere with HelloSign's eSignature functionality. Test the API forÂ free.

HelloSign, a Dropbox Company sponsor

DOCX 7.5: Generate Word .docx Files from Node or Browser â€” The code to lay out your documents is quite verbose, but thereâ€™s a lot of functionality baked in. Hereâ€™s a basic CodePen-based example. â€“ GitHubÂ repo.

Dolan Miu

pcl.js: Point Cloud Library (PCL) for Browser, Powered by WebAssembly â€” A â€˜point cloudâ€™ is essentially lots of points projected in 3D space (live example.) This is a good example of bringing a large C++ library into the JavaScript world by way ofÂ WebAssembly.

Darkce

Japa: An Alternative Testing Framework for Node â€” Coming from the same team as AdonisJS (a Node.js web framework), Japa slides into your existing workflows with no build tool requirements. You get first-class support for OpenAPI schema driven testing of endpoints, dataset driven tests, and a VS CodeÂ extension.

AdonisJS Team

Command Palette for Vue: A Ctrl/Cmd+K Style Interface for Vue.js â€” Inspired by Reactâ€™s cmdk and kbar. BTW, if youâ€™ve never tried pressing Cmd+K (Ctrl+K on non Macs) while surfing GitHub.. give it aÂ go. GitHubÂ repo.

Yunwei Xiao

Seamlessly Add Chat and Activity Feeds to YourÂ Applications

Stream sponsor

Precessing (p8g): A General Purpose, Cross Language 2D Library â€” Itâ€™s not often you see a graphics library thatâ€™s for C, C++, Java and JavaScript â€“ yes, WebAssembly is responsible again. You get a Canvas-esque API (docs) plus inputÂ processing.

Bernhard Fritz

âš¡ï¸ OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

  • ws 8.9
    â†³ Simple & fast WebSocket client and server for Node.js.

  • Semgrep 0.114
    â†³ Multi-language static analysis tool. Think grep for syntax.

  • Flat 6.0 â€“ Flatten/unflatten nested objects.

  • React Joyride 2.5.3 â€“ Create guided tours for apps.

  • Mantine 5.4 â€“ Extensive React component library.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior UI Dev â€” Join us and innovate with MicroFrontends, custom Node tools, build systems (Webpack/GitHub Actions), TypeScript, React, and more with a11y and DX inÂ mind.
Vertex Inc

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸš— Fancy a late night drive?

In Nightdrive, James Stanley gives us both a visual experience of driving at night and an explanation of how it works. It's a simple idea put to good effect, though if you want something more intense, try Rezmason'sÂ Drivy..Â ğŸ˜

While we're having some fun down here: over on Twitter, Nils Eriksson decided to get crafty and ğŸ¦ implemented Tic-Tac-Toe in TypeScript types (known as 'noughts and crosses' in my kingdom) and wrote an extensive blog post about it. XOX.

Till next week!
â€“ Peter Cooper, your editor.

Mantine 5.4 â€“ Extensive React component library.








ğŸ’» Jobs





  
Senior UI Dev â€” Join us and innovate with MicroFrontends, custom Node tools, build systems (Webpack/GitHub Actions), TypeScript, React, and more with a11y and DX inÂ mind.
  
Vertex Inc 
  


  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
  
Hired 
  










ğŸš— Fancy a late night drive?


  




In Nightdrive, James Stanley gives us both a visual experience of driving at night and an explanation of how it works. It's a simple idea put to good effect, though if you want something more intense, try Rezmason'sÂ Drivy..Â ğŸ˜
While we're having some fun down here: over on Twitter, Nils Eriksson decided to get crafty and ğŸ¦ implemented Tic-Tac-Toe in TypeScript types (known as 'noughts and crosses' in my kingdom) and wrote an extensive blog post about it. XOX.
Till next week!
â€“ Peter Cooper, your editor.

items.title: Seven weird ways to call a JavaScript function
items.content:
#â€‹606 â€” September 16, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

MemLab: A Framework for Finding JavaScript Memory Leaks â€” Facebook (sorry, Meta) has been using MemLab to make significant improvements to the memory use of its main SPA. Now theyâ€™ve open sourced the tool (which is itself written in TypeScript) with the hope everyone else can achieve similarÂ improvements.

Liang Gong and Glenn Conner (Meta)

ğŸ’¡ Nolan Lawson's Fuite is another, smaller, tool worth considering in this space.

JavaScript APIs You Donâ€™t Know About â€” Itâ€™s a bold headline because plenty of you will have at least heard of these APIs, but itâ€™s a good roundup nonetheless to catch up on what the Web platform offers. APIs covered include the Page Visibility, Web Sharing, and Broadcast ChannelÂ APIs.

Smashing Magazine

Frontend Masters Community Sale â€” Celebrate new community features with $100 off a yearly membership â€“ our first discount in over 3 years! SeeÂ details.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Best Practices for Creating a Modern npm Package â€” A step-by-step â€œas of 2022â€ walkthrough of creating your own npm package using current best practices. Itâ€™s very thorough and certainly worth revisiting, even if youâ€™ve built a package already. As always, though, thereâ€™s more than one way to do it, and other tools like np can be brought into the mix asÂ needed.

Brian Clark (Snyk)

IN BRIEF:

  • Safari 16.0 is out and jam packed with new features and support for Web features (passkeys, Web Inspector Extensions, container queries, Shared Workers and more) you might need to brush up on.

  • Node.js is getting some security releases on September 22 across all supported lines due to multiple issues (some of 'high' severity).

  • Talking of Node, ğŸ“… Nodeconf EU 2022 is taking place on October 3-5 in Ireland and they've offered a discount code of NodeWeekly2022 for readers. (Note: We have no financial connection with them.)

RELEASES:

  • Spacetime 7.2 â€“ Lightweight timezone library.

  • React Router 6.4
    â†³ Now with backported Remix features.

  • Fastify 4.6
    â†³ Fast, low overhead web framework for Node.

  • Preact 10.11
    â†³ 3KB React alternative with the same API.

  • Cypress 10.8
    â†³ Easy testing for anything in a browser.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

The Seventh Way to Call a Function Without Parentheses â€” If youâ€™re surprised that there were even six ways, this is for you. These are almost entirely â€˜tricksâ€™ but ones that can be important when it comes to security or sanitizing user suppliedÂ code.

Gareth Heyes

Whatâ€™s New with HTML Forms in 2022? â€” Some useful additions to working with forms that you might haveÂ missedâ€¦

Ollie Williams

Snyk Finds PyPi Malware That Steals Discord & Roblox Credential and Payment Info â€” Read about the latest PyPi malware found by the Snyk security research team stealing Discord & Roblox paymentÂ info.

Snyk sponsor

The Secret of Successfully Using Multi Window WebGL Canvas â€” This is technical and most of us wonâ€™t need to dig so deep, but it's a neat exploration of using an offscreen canvas to render using separate worker contexts - these can then be used in other tabs or browserÂ windows.

Tobias Uhlig

Why the type="number" Input is the Worst Input â€” Think that web form has got your number? If you used input type=â€numberâ€, you may be surprised to find that itÂ doesnâ€™t.

Jared Toporek

useSyncExternalStore: The Underrated React Hook? â€” A hook for subscribing to external data sources. But did you know it can also be used to stop over-returning React hooks triggering needlessÂ re-renders?

SÃ©bastien Lorber

Conditionally Spreading Objects in JavaScript â€” A technique I've not seen before.
Amit Merchant

Multithreading in JavaScript with Web Workers
Badmus Kola beginner

A Guide to Rounding Numbers in JavaScript
Darren Jones beginner

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

npm-check-updates: Update package.json Dependencies to the Latest Versions â€” That is, as opposed to the specified versions. A particularly neat feature is the -i interactive mode so you can look at potential upgrades and then action them one byÂ one.

Raine Revere

â¤ï¸ Loving console.log Is Easy, but hate ğŸ˜¡ Losing Context to View Messy Output â€” Developer productivity tools Wallaby.js, Quokka.js, and Console Ninja (coming soon) show console.log values and errors right next to yourÂ code.

Wallaby.js sponsor

SafeQL: An ESLint Plugin for Your SQL Queries â€” Clever idea. It hooks into your database and then guides you as to mistakes you might make when writing SQL queries in your JavaScript code. Postgres only for now, but supports any client.. whether Prisma, pg, Sequelize, orÂ whatever.

ts-safeql

Theatre.js 0.5: Hackable Motion Design for the Web â€” Can be used both programmatically and visually to animate 3D objects created with things like Three.js, React Three Fiber, HTML/SVG, or even to â€˜animateâ€™ variable values. v0.5 introduces 3D scene editing and complex keyframing. Docs and GitHubÂ repo.

Theatre.js Project

Code Capsules: The Simplest Way to Deploy Your Code

Code Capsules sponsor

âš¡ï¸ OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

  • React Grid Gallery 1.0
    â†³ Justified image gallery component.

  • sablejs 1.1
    â†³ ES5.1 interpreter written in pure JS.

  • Crunker 2.0
    â†³ Concatenate audio files with the Web Audio API.

  • ka-table 7.6
    â†³ React table component with sorting, filtering, etc.

  • d3-graphviz 4.4
    â†³ Graphviz DOT rendering and animated transitions.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior UI Dev â€” Join us and innovate with MicroFrontends, custom Node tools, build systems (Webpack/Github Actions), TypeScript, React, and more with a11y and DX inÂ mind.
Vertex Inc

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

A LITTLE BIT OF FUN AT THE END:

ğŸ•¹ Infernal Throne is a small Metroidvania-style game written for the js13kGames JavaScript coding competition. Source available here.

A key part of delivering Infernal Throne within a mere 13 kilobytes is the use of Roadroller, a tool we linked to a year ago, which is specifically designed to crush JavaScript code down as small as possible (so much so that it's almost entirely unreadable).

items.title: Anyone know Larry Ellison?
items.content:
#â€‹605 â€” September 9, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Ryan Dahl Asks Oracle to Release the 'JavaScript' Trademark â€” It's in our small print, but did you know Oracle owns the 'JavaScript' trademark? This is why the standard is called ECMAScript instead. Itâ€™s all down to Netscapeâ€™s deal with Sun Microsystems, which Oracle later acquired, and is infamously poorly defended (Brendan Eich suggested many years ago that heâ€™s not sure it could be defended.) So if youâ€™ve got Larry Ellisonâ€™s phone number, see if heâ€™ll do us all aÂ solidÂ ğŸ™

Ryan Dahl

Make the Most of Testing in CI with Cypress Dashboard â€” Cypress Dashboard accelerates and optimizes every facet of your testing. Push your code with confidence, everyÂ time.

Cypress.io sponsor

An Overview of Node.js's Architecture, Event Loop, and Concurrency â€” Our favorite JavaScript-wielding doctor is writing a new book (â€œWriting cross-platform shell scripts with Node.jsâ€) and we get to enjoy the byproducts of his labor including this succinct, but highly technical, overview of Nodeâ€™s fundamentalÂ parts.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Introducing Signals: A Reactive State Primitive That's Fast ByÂ Default â€” Signals provide a reactive way of expressing state (in a very natural way that feels like using plain values) such that apps stay fast regardless of complexity. Itâ€™s aimed at Preact, the slimmer alternative to React, but is possible to use with regular React by way ofÂ monkeypatching.

Preact Team

IN BRIEF:

  • React Native 0.70 has been released and Hermes becomes the default JavaScript engine, amongst other things.

  • A timeline of JavaScript's history from 1994 to now.

  • ğŸ“† Next.js Conf 2022 is taking place this October â€“ it's online and no cost to sign up. Next.js also has a new logo.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v18.9.0 â€“ A very minor release.
  • Next.js 12.3 â€“ Popular React framework.
  • Jasmine 4.4
    â†³ Simple testing framework for browsers and Node.
  • Ember.js 4.7 â€“ Long standing framework.
  • sql.js 1.8
    â†³ SQLite compiled to JavaScript.
  • React Calendar 3.8
    â†³ Calendar component for React apps.
  • Fresh 1.1
    â†³ Deno's full stack Web framework.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Porting Tests from Cypress to Playwright with AI â€” If switching libraries for your integration tests sounds boring but necessary, maybe AI could take away some of the strain? Gajus gave it a go with moderate success â€“ a funÂ story.

Gajus Kuizinas

The Temporal API: A New Approach to Managing Date and Time? â€” Weâ€™ve mentioned this a few times over the years (Dr. Axel wrote this thorough guide in 2021) but it continues to merely be â€˜in developmentâ€™ with no widespread support yet. There is a polyfill, though, and it really is a handy API, so you might want to brush up onÂ it.

Muhammed Arslan Sarwar

ğŸ“† Â Unblock - A CI/CD Conference by Buildkite â€” A 2-day virtual conference featuring industry experts using cutting edge processes and tools to define the future of how we deliver software. Registration and CFP nowÂ open.

Buildkite sponsor

â–¶Â Â Creating F1 Style Graphics with Remotion â€” Fans of Formula 1 may remember the stinger transition from the 2021 season. The author of Remotionâ€”a library that can generate video from codeâ€”walks through its recreation in what can only be described as record lapÂ time.

Jonny Berger

  • How to Build a Canvas-Based Drawing Tool
    â†³ An extensive, and now complete, four part series.

  • "How I migrated a Rails app from Webpack to esbuild"
    â†³ An app with over 300k lines of JS, too.

  • Deploying a Node app to Fly.io
    â†³ One of our favorite 'challenger' hosting platforms right now.

  • TIL You Can Access a Userâ€™s Camera with Just HTML
    â†³ Browser support rather limited though.

  • "Switching iterator helpers to functions"
    â†³ Slidedeck for a talk Dr. Axel Rauschmayer is giving at TC39 next week.

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ğŸ” Â GradeJS: Scan Production Webpack Bundles for Modules UsedÂ Within â€” Even if you donâ€™t have access to the original source for a web site, this tool can try and figure out what npm packages were used even with minified or tree-shaken bundles (if webpack 3-5 wasÂ used).

Konstantin Darutkin

El: A Tiny Web Component-Based UI Framework â€” The very definition of short and sweet. You get a lot in 150 lines, including a built-in observable store and reactive templates with one-way binding. Think a very lightweight React/Vue mixed with Lit. Hereâ€™s a one file example of creating a todo-list app on top ofÂ it.

Frameable

Spend More Time Growing Your App and Leave the RestÂ toÂ Stream â€” Why spend months building in-app messaging or activity feeds from scratch when you can quickly integrate these important functionalities with Streamâ€™s APIs and developer-friendlyÂ SDKs.

Stream sponsor

ğŸ“ª Â ZIPMonster: US ZIP Code Data and Functions â€” Brings the US postal code system all into one library which lets you do all manner of queries, including navigating across the entire US, if you wish.

Igor M.

Shumani: Fast Machine Learning Library using Bun + Flashlight â€” Interesting to see Facebookâ€™s research arm using Bun â€“ very early days for this experimentalÂ project.

Meta Research

JSON Hero: A Beautiful JSON Viewer â€” Paste in some JSON or enter a URL to a JSON file and this tool provides a clean and beautiful UI packed withÂ features.

API Hero

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. UseÂ Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

DgrmJS: A Library for Creating SVG Diagrams â€” Particularly for flow/processÂ diagrams.

Alexey Boyko

âš¡ï¸ OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

  • size-limit 8.1 â€” Performance budget tool.

  • Serverless Offline 10.0
    â†³ Emulate AWS Lambda and API Gateway locally.

  • react-cytoscapejs 2.0
    â†³ React component for network visualizations.

  • Discordeno 14.0
    â†³ Discord API library for Deno.

  • HotKeys 3.10
    â†³ Long-standing low footprint input capture.

  • Binary Parser 2.2
    â†³ Write fast binary data parsers declaratively.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± â€” Join CKEditor team to develop an Open Source project used by millions of users around the world ğŸš€and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Full-Stack Engineer (NYC / Remote) â€” 100M+ devices, 100B+ API calls. Radar is looking for Product Engineers to build geospatial devÂ tools.
Radar

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
